title: Job 34:1
text: FURTHERMORE Elihu answered and said,

title: Job 34:2
text: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

title: Job 34:3
text: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

title: Job 34:4
text: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.

title: Job 34:5
text: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.

title: Job 34:6
text: Should I lie against my right?  my wound is incurable without transgression.

title: Job 34:7
text: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

title: Job 34:8
text: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

title: Job 34:9
text: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

title: Job 34:10
text: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.

title: Job 34:11
text: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

title: Job 34:12
text: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

title: Job 34:13
text: Who hath given him a charge over the earth?  or who hath disposed the whole world?

title: Job 34:14
text: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;

title: Job 34:15
text: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

title: Job 34:16
text: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.

title: Job 34:17
text: Shall even he that hateth right govern?  and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?

title: Job 34:18
text: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked?  and to princes, Ye are ungodly?

title: Job 34:19
text: How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor?  for they all are the work of his hands.

title: Job 34:20
text: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.

title: Job 34:21
text: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.

title: Job 34:22
text: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

title: Job 34:23
text: For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.

title: Job 34:24
text: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.

title: Job 34:25
text: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

title: Job 34:26
text: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

title: Job 34:27
text: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

title: Job 34:28
text: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

title: Job 34:29
text: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble?  and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him?  whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:

title: Job 34:30
text: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.

title: Job 34:31
text: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:

title: Job 34:32
text: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.

title: Job 34:33
text: Should it be according to thy mind?  he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

title: Job 34:34
text: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.

title: Job 34:35
text: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.

title: Job 34:36
text: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.

title: Job 34:37
text: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
